message: Hi Bob, I'm offering you a unique opportunity to acquire a valuable product. I believe it has the potential to be very beneficial for you. My initial asking price is $1500000. I'm confident this is a fair price considering the product's worth. Please let me know your thoughts.
I'm still interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $1200000. I believe the product is valuable, but I need to be mindful of my budget.

Bob, I appreciate your interest and understand your budget constraints. While I value your offer, $1200000 is still significantly below what I believe this product is worth. To demonstrate my willingness to compromise, I'm willing to lower the price to $1350000.  This price reflects the true value of the product while acknowledging your concerns. Let's see if we can reach an agreement.
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I'm still a bit hesitant about the price. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'm thinking more along the lines of $1275000. Can we discuss further?

Bob, I understand you're looking for a good deal, and I'm committed to finding common ground.  I'm willing to meet you halfway again, but I can't go lower than $1312500. This price reflects the true value of the product and recognizes your financial constraints. Let's make this happen.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway again, but I'm still a bit short of my target. I'm willing to make one more concession, so I'm thinking more along the lines of $1250000. Can we discuss further?
